Description: Egyptian terracotta figure plaque of (probably Ithyphallic) Harpocrates with side knot. Head only. Crudely made. Mould-made and solid with crude back. Light red-brown Nile silt fabric with grey core. Abundant fine gold mica, quartz, organics and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Gutch dates this piece between 150BC and 250AD based upon it's stratigraphic position (a surface find), though he mentions the possibility that it could be earlier (Hogarth 1899, pl. 12, no.143). A good parallel, possibly from the same mould was dated 5th to 4th century BC (Bayer-Niemeier 1988, pl.83.6, no.456). This was probably made in Naukratis, with examples found at the site, now in Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology (NA614, NA588) and Bristol Museum (H841). Similar style unprovenanced pieces are generally dated 5th to early 4th century BC or end of the Late Period (Fischer 1994 pl.2, no.9; Török 1995, 52-3, nos 48-50). Bayer Niemeier, E. 1988. Liebieghaus Museum Alter Plastik. Bildwerke der Sammlung Kaufmann, 1. Griechisch-römische Terrakotten. Melsungen. Fischer, J. 1994. Griechisch-römische Terrakotten aus Ägypten. Die Sammlungen Sieglin und Schreiber. Dresden, Leipzig, Stuttgart, Tübingen. Tübingen, Wasmuth. Török, L. 1995. Hellenistic and Roman terracottas from Egypt. Roma.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DC.092) (Phase 1)
